summary:
Here is a clear and concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council expresses grave alarm and concern over the deteriorating security and humanitarian crisis in South Sudan. It condemns the fighting, targeted violence against civilians, and human rights violations by all parties. The Council reaffirms its commitment to South Sudan's sovereignty and territorial integrity.

The Council welcomes the Intergovernmental Authority on Development's (IGAD) initiative to mediate between key leaders and commends the United Nations Mission in South Sudan's (UNMISS) efforts to protect civilians. It condemns attacks on UNMISS personnel and facilities, demanding that all parties respect the inviolability of United Nations premises.

The Council, acting under Chapter VII, calls for an immediate cessation of hostilities and dialogue. It demands cooperation with UNMISS, endorses the Secretary-General's recommendation to increase UNMISS' force levels, and authorizes the temporary deployment of up to 12,500 troops and 1,323 police personnel.

The Council requests the Secretary-General to report on the implementation of the resolution within 15 days and every 30 days thereafter. It urges Member States to facilitate the deployment of troops and resources to UNMISS.
